comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: An extension now stands in the driveway where this moment was captured - Google Maps Street View Designed by A. J. MacDonald (1864-1951) in September 1891 while an Assistant Architect for the Public Works Department of Victoria (1889-1897). One of a number of remarkable building designs produced while he was still in his 20s. - A J Macdonald: Enigma and Romance in the Public Service by Anne Neale in FABRICATIONS, Volume 10, August 1999. left image by [http://www.flickr.com/photos/phunnyfotos/] phunnyfotos (2006) right image from [http://www.flickr.com/photos/24567473@N02/] 65butterflies' collection (c.1908-1915)

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content:
According to the National Archives of Australia, there were five men with the surname Tratford who served in the A.I.F. during World War 2, plus one with the surname Tratford who was enlisted in the Militia across the war years. 

 Only one has a forename of Wallace.  Although the file is not digitised for online viewing, the index details are this:

"TRATFORD WALLACE ARCHIBALD : Service Number - VX116822 : Date of birth - 15 Nov 1922 : Place of birth - YEA VIC : Place of enlistment - PRESTON : Next of Kin - TRATFORD MARIE"

Although we would need to confirm it by reading the file, it was almost universal for married men to list their wives as next of kin.  This strongly suggests that the joyous woman welcoming her husband home from the front is Marie Tratford.

Here's Wally Tratford's face:

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/national_library_of_australia_commons/6174085326/in/photostream]

comment.author: 24469639@N00
comment._content:
The 1942 and 1949 electoral roles (via ancestry.com) have James Wallace Tratford , Constable and Ethel May Tratford, at Main St. Drouin.  This must be the couple in the doorway.

The 1949 role also has a Wallace Archibald Tratford (sheet metal worker) at Reservoir, Darebin, which would be Wally whose military record and photograph are shown above. It also lists Marie Junette Tratford at that location, pretty much confirming the suggestion that she, as next of kin, was Wallace's wife.

So yes, the woman could quite possibly be Marie, although I wouldn't discount entirely the possibility that it could be another family member, for example a sister.

comment.author: 67193564@N03
comment._content: Wow! You've really brought the story together and great to see what it looks like now. Thanks so much.

comment.author: 20958381@N08
comment._content:
There arare also WWII service records for TRATFORD ERIC JAMES : Service Number - V331904 : Date of birth - 09 Jan 1908 : Place of birth - YEA VIC : Place of enlistment - TATURA VIC : Next of Kin - Unknown & TRATFORD WALTER WILLIAM : Service Number - V508723 : Date of birth - 13 Feb 1906 : Place of birth - YEA VIC : Place of enlistment - YEA VIC : Next of Kin - PILFOOT SHEILA

Possibly related to Wally as, like him, they were born in Yea.

Wonder if the NAA might digitise them to reveal more :-)
